dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: OceanX just pledged about a hundred million dollars to ocean conservation, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: OceanX just pledged about a hundred million dollars to ocean conservation, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Bloomberg Bloomberg Philanthropies confirmed that it is committing $86 million over four years, and OceanX said it is pledging about $100 million over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Bloomberg Philanthropies is putting in eighty-five million over four years too. That's a massive joint effort.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Bloomberg Philanthropies is putting in eighty-five million over four years too. That's a massive joint effort.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Bloomberg Bloomberg Philanthropies confirmed that it is committing $86 million over four years, and OceanX said it is pledging about $100 million over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they announced it at the Our Ocean Conference in Jakarta on Monday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they announced it at the Our Ocean Conference in Jakarta on Monday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The partnership was announced on Sunday Oct. 28 at the 5th Annual Our Ocean Conference in Indonesia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's all about tackling pollution, overfishing, climate change… you know, the big threats.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all about tackling pollution, overfishing, climate change... you know, the big threats.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They aim to combat the impact of pollution, destructive fishing practices and climate change on the ocean, which makes up more than two-thirds of the Earths surface.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They mentioned that disconnect—like, people are losing touch with how vital the ocean is, even though it covers two-thirds of the planet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They mentioned that disconnect-like, people are losing touch with how vital the ocean is, even though it covers two-thirds of the planet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The partnership is based on the premise that there is a disconnect between humans and their relationship to the ocean, and that threats to the ocean are increasing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Over three billion people depend on it for food and jobs, so this isn't just an environmental issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Over three billion people depend on it for food and jobs, so this isn't just an environmental issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than three billion people depend on the oceans for food and their livelihoods, Bloomberg said in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not just throwing money at it—they're doing exploration, like that recent expedition to the Northeast Canyons monument.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not just throwing money at it-they're doing exploration, like that recent expedition to the Northeast Canyons monument.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, UN special envoy for climate action and a former New York City mayor, and Dalio, founder of hedge fund firm Bridgewater Associates, made the announcement at the conclusion of a recent joint project, an expedition to the U.S.s first national marine monument in the Atlantic Ocean, called the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: On the Alucia, right? That's OceanX's research vessel. They went to parts no one had ever seen before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: On the Alucia, right? That's OceanX's research vessel. They went to parts no one had ever seen before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The expedition made on OceanXs vessel, the Alucia, explored parts of the underwater site that had never been visited by humans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is so cool. It's about getting that footage, that data, to really show people what's at stake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is so cool. It's about getting that footage, that data, to really show people what's at stake.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Bloomberg said they're starting "in their own backyard" to inspire global action. Smart approach.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Bloomberg said they're starting in their own backyard to inspire global action. Smart approach.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By starting in our own backyard, we hope to inspire Americans and others around the world as they conserve their own national waters, Bloomberg said in a video on Sunday announcing the partnership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, when you have names like Michael Bloomberg and Ray Dalio backing it, it definitely gets attention.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, when you have names like Michael Bloomberg and Ray Dalio backing it, it definitely gets attention.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, UN special envoy for climate action and a former New York City mayor, and Dalio, founder of hedge fund firm Bridgewater Associates, made the announcement at the conclusion of a recent joint project, an expedition to the U.S.s first national marine monument in the Atlantic Ocean, called the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Hopefully this partnership drives real change—advocacy, education, the whole package.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Hopefully this partnership drives real change-advocacy, education, the whole package.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the organizations will support the exploration of threatened marine areas to advance scientific understanding, public awareness and education, advocacy and conservation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: We need more of these collaborations, honestly. The ocean can't wait.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: We need more of these collaborations, honestly. The ocean can't wait.

artist_script:
OceanX just pledged about a hundred million dollars to ocean conservation, which is huge.
HostB: Yeah, and Bloomberg Philanthropies is putting in eighty-five million over four years too. That’s a massive joint effort.
HostA: Right? And they announced it at the Our Ocean Conference in Jakarta on Monday.
HostB: It’s all about tackling pollution, overfishing, climate change… you know, the big threats.
HostA: They mentioned that disconnect—like, people are losing touch with how vital the ocean is, even though it covers two-thirds of the planet.
HostB: Exactly. Over three billion people depend on it for food and jobs, so this isn’t just an environmental issue.
HostA: And they’re not just throwing money at it—they’re doing exploration, like that recent expedition to the Northeast Canyons monument.
HostB: On the Alucia, right? That’s OceanX’s research vessel. They went to parts no one had ever seen before.
HostA: Which is so cool. It’s about getting that footage, that data, to really show people what’s at stake.
HostB: Yeah, and Bloomberg said they’re starting “in their own backyard” to inspire global action. Smart approach.
HostA: I mean, when you have names like Michael Bloomberg and Ray Dalio backing it, it definitely gets attention.
HostB: For sure. Hopefully this partnership drives real change—advocacy, education, the whole package.
HostA: We need more of these collaborations, honestly. The ocean can’t wait.
